WRITING.TITLE: Logan did nothing wrong?
WRITING.TEXT: Sorry if this has been discussed before!! I was rewatching season 6 episode 17 when Rory finds out that Logan hooked up with a bunch of girls while he thought they were broken up. I know that many people can #8217;t stand Logan and this is a huge part of the reason but I can #8217;t help but think he didn #8217;t do anything wrong? Even though, yes, Rory thought they were just taking a hiatus, he actually DID think that they were broken up. In my opinion, he did nothing wrong. It #8217;s similar to Ross and Rachel in Friends! THEY WERE ON A BREAK!! Sure, it #8217;s not the best way to move on from someone, but it #8217;s not necessarily bad. Thoughts on Logan #8217;s behavior? Is it just because he didn #8217;t confirm with Rory that they were broken up?

Valid point!! The fact that there wasn't an actual discussion about breaking up between Rory and Logan *does* make it seem less okay. It's hard to think that I wouldn't be just as upset as Rory if I were in the same position.

Yes 100%! Rory had a total right to be angry, but it wasn't fair to say that she forgave him when clearly she did not. At that point in their relationship, I felt they didn't communicate as well as they should have.

For sure! He didn't communicate with Rory AT ALL. It's not fair to just assume something huge like that in a relationship without discussing it. And I think him saying that to Honor just to get her off his back is totally just him trying to get out of it when Rory confronted him. I think he meant it when he told Honor.

Oh yes the Jess thing! I forgot about that! Rory 100% just wanted to hook up with Jess and then felt bad after she kissed him. Technically, Logan never cheated on Rory (since he "broke" up with her through his sister), but Rory DEFINITELY cheated on Logan. And I don't remember her ever telling Logan that she kissed Jess? So that was definitely a huge secret she kept from him for the rest of their relationship.
LOVE your username btw. Emily would be proud.
Completely agree! What he did DEFINITELY wasn't nice and Rory had a right to be upset. BUT it's still not classified as cheating.

Totally agree about the ghosting thing. It doesn #8217;t seem fair that she didn #8217;t contact him for weeks and then she calls it cheating when she goes and kisses Jess just because she #8217;s mad at Logan? I love Rory but sometimes it feels like she only wants things done on her terms and puts the blame on everyone else. Even when she kissed Jess she said #8220;I couldn #8217;t even cheat on him the way he cheated on me. #8221; By saying that she #8217;s just justifying her actions when she #8217;s clearly being a hypocrite.

Hahaha yeah Dean could get a little annoying from time to time. What annoyed me the most about him was after he got married and cheated on his wife with Rory... I felt that it completely went against the character that was originally portrayed for him. The show made us not like Dean by the end of it. I wish that Rory had never gone back to him. I loved Jess the most, I felt that especially towards the end he seemed the most mature and put Rory's best interest at heart. I love that he was the one who finally put her back on track when she dropped out of Yale. I like Logan a lot too, actually! I feel like Rory would've been happy marrying him. I thought it was so sweet that he put so much thought into her happiness and where she could work and how their lives would be if she moved to California with him.

The morning commute to work was always a hassle for Tom. He always left for work at exactly 8:10. He left at this time because he knew the neighbor in the house to his left always left for work at 8:15, but his neighbor in the house to his right would wait outside on the sidewalk with his children until the 8:05 bus was there to take them to school. If he left before 8:05, he might run into the newspaper delivery boy who made his rounds anywhere from 7:30 to 8. 8:10 was the right time for Tom because he wouldn't have to speak with anyone on the way to his car. Tom opened the door to his house and peaked his head outside, glancing around. He saw the school bus already down the street and his neighbors car was no longer in the driveway. Tom quickly stepped outside, coffee in hand and keys in the other. He locked up and quietly made his way down his walkway towards the brown Volvo parked in front of his mailbox. Tom was just about to open the door when the newspaper delivery boy comes barreling down the street. "Good morning, Mr. Andrews!" The delivery boy exclaimed. *"Damn*," Tom thought. "Good morning, Freddie." Tom said back as Freddie slowed to a stop in front of him. "**But, in fact, it was not a good morning for Tom at all**, #8221; A omniscient voice boomed overhead. #8220;**Tom had a headache from his usual lonely late-night drinking and had woken up to discover that he had left two voicemails and six text messages for his ex-girlfriend, Delia. She has not returned his messages.** #8221; Tom looked at Freddie. His mouth was hanging open and his eyes widened. He slowly closed his mouth and was silent for a moment. #8220;Well, I gotta run #8230; I #8217;m late with my delivery this morning, #8221; Freddie said, handing Tom #8217;s newspaper to him. #8220;See ya, Freddie, #8221; Tom said, embarrassed. He watched as Freddie hopped back on his bike and sped off down the street. Tom sighed and got into his car. He drove the usual route to work, silently convincing himself to forget the incident the whole way. Tom parked the car at 8:21 and sat in it, finishing his coffee. *Tap, tap, tap!* Startled, Tom dropped his coffee in his lap and screamed out in pain. The hot coffee was already seeping into his shirt. Tom heard a gasp and slight chuckle. He looked up to see his 23 year old coworker, Ron, waving at him from the passenger window. Annoyed, Tom rolled down the window. #8220;Had a spill there, eh? #8221; Ron said, laughing. #8220;You gotta be more careful. #8221; #8220;You #8217;re right, Ron. Sorry. #8221; Tom said, dripping with coffee and sarcasm. #8220;Well I hope I #8217;m not bothering you here, Tom. I just wanted to say hello. #8221; Ron said. #8220;You #8217;re not bothering me, Ron. I just need to clean this up. #8221; Tom said wiping his shirt with an old napkin. #8220;**Actually, Ron was bothering Tom. In fact, he often bothers Tom daily. Tom has even gone to his manager to complain about how annoying he found Tom, in hopes to get him moved to a different department.** #8221; The voice thundered. Ron stood there, wide-eyed. He slowly stood back up, away from the window, and walked away from Tom #8217;s car. #8220;Shit, #8221; Tom said aloud. He quickly tucked his coffee-stained shirt back into his pants, grabbed his briefcase and jumped out of the car. Tom walked nervously into work at 8:32. He passed Ron sitting at his desk, who scoffed when Tom waked past and leaned over to whisper something in his colleague #8217;s ear. Both of them looked at Tom in disgust. Tom got to his cubicle and sat down at his desk. #8220;You #8217;re late, #8221; Tom heard a voice behind him. Tom turned around to see his boss standing there, impatiently tapping his foot. #8220;Yes, I apologize, Mr. Ruthersworth. I had a little accident with my coffee this morning, #8221; Tom said, sheepishly showing him the brown stain on his shirt. Mr. Ruthersworth briefly glanced at Tom #8217;s shirt and said, #8220;Follow me. I need to speak with you in my office. #8221; Tom got up and quickly followed behind, past Ron #8217;s desk and into Mr. Ruthersworth #8217;s large office. #8220;Sit down, Tom, #8221; Mr. Ruthersworth gestured to the gray chair in front of his oak wooden desk. Tom sat down and waited patiently while Mr. Ruthersworth shuffled through some papers on his desk. #8220;Ah, #8221; Mr. Ruthersworth said, finding the correct paper and placing it in front of him. #8220;Tom, you have worked at this office for six months. I hired you because had the correct qualifications and seemed capable enough to do the job asked of you. I hired you even though none of your previous employers would give me a good reference, and you haven #8217;t seemed to hold a job longer than a year at any of the corporations listed on your resume. I gave you the benefit of the doubt. #8221; He said, looking sternly at Tom. Tom shifted in his seat, but said nothing. #8220;During your time here, you have been late a total of 11 times, used up all of your sick days, offended multiple of your coworkers, and seem to put in minimal effort. Tom looked down into his lap, anger growing inside of him. #8220;I have given you every chance in the book, Tom, and I think I #8217;ve been very generous. #8221; Mr. Ruthersworth said. Tom looked up and glared at Mr. Ruthersworth. Tom had had enough. #8220;Mr. Ruthersworth, with all due respect, I hate working here. You, with your yellow teeth and your bad toupee? You walk around here as if you own the place when everyone knows you make little more than your own employees. You only got this job because your sister works in corporate and you couldn #8217;t find a job with the only thing on your resume being Assistant Manager at Dairy Queen. I hate this place, the people in it, and I hate working for you. #8221; Mr. Ruthersworth stood up from his chair, red in the face. #8220;You #8217;re fired! #8221; He exclaimed, furiously. #8220;Mr. Ruthersworth, you're not firing me. I quit! #8221; Tom shouted, getting up from his own chair. #8220;**But indeed, Tom was fired.** #8221; The voice boomed overhead.
Okay but is that vet wearing a fake beard?

WRITING.TITLE: Looking to switch to project management
WRITING.TEXT: Hello! I am completing my MBA in Strategic Management in June 2020. I have 5 years experience of being in charge of a medical records department at a mental health clinic. I am looking to switch my career into Project Management, however I do not have any experience in the area. I am wondering if my management experience + my MBA will be enough, or should I also look into getting a project management certification? Thank you in advance for anyone who can offer some friendly advice!
Thank you so much! This really helps a lot. Are you a project manager now?
Wow congrats! That's amazing. #8203; Thanks for your help and I wish you the best of luck with everything!
Yay thank you! This is so helpful. I think will take the exam as soon as I'm finished with MBA so I'll definitely check out her books.
Great, thanks! I'll take a look!

Forgot to extend my student residence permit -- what do I do?
WRITING.TEXT: Hello! I am from the United States, and I am a student in the Czech Republic. My residence permit will expire on September 26. I have two problems: 1. I am leaving the country to go back to the United States until September 17. I must take this trip, I am unable to cancel it. Does anyone know if I am able to extend my visa from a Czech embassy in the United States? I was unable to find information about it on their website. 2. I am aware I must have a confirmation of accommodation in the form of a lease contract... I am moving out of my current apartment on October 6 and have not found a new one yet. My plan was to rent an AirBnB if I had not found one before I move out. My question is, will my current lease contract suffice, or must I have moved into a new apartment before applying? Thank you for your help!
This is good advice! Thank you!!!
Thank you so much! I really appreciate all the advice!

WRITING.TITLE: Need to vent about Season 4 Episode 5!!
WRITING.TEXT: This is the episode where Lorelai and Sookie hire an interior decorator (Natalie) for the Dragonfly who also happens to have done a job at Emily #8217;s house. Is anyone else bothered by the fact that Lorelai just could not keep Natalie on as the Dragonfly #8217;s decorator even at the protest of Sookie? It bothers me so much. Yes, I get that she doesn #8217;t want to be associated with Emily in any way, however she completely ignores her partnership with Sookie and fires Natalie! She should be making her decisions WITH Sookie. I love Lorelai and her overall character but sometimes I can #8217;t stand her selfishness. Anyway, the rant is over hahaha
Ah such a good point! It #8217;s so weird that Sookie wouldn #8217;t be included in all that
Agreed. It makes no sense at all!
Hahaha sometimes she so childish!
